title: Cover Picture and Issue Information
content:
Cover image: An adult female roe deer (Capreolus capreolus) standing in a mature wheat field, with only its head visible. New results provide insights on how agricultural practices shape the food-safety trade-off for roe deer in agroecosystems. Findings suggest that, avoiding landscape homogenisation by simultaneously cultivating several crop types which provide alternative cover over the year, may favour woodland species with high behavioural plasticity. (pp. 564–574).
